type.name: maths_value_including_maths_space
type.description: A maths_space is also a maths_value.

description.p: A Maths_space is a set of things for which mathematical functions are defined.
description.note: The details of the attributes of Maths_space are described in ISO 10303-50, and are not repeated here.
description.p: The following subtypes of Maths_space are within the scope of this part of ISO 10303:

dd.p: A Maths_space that is one of:
A Maths_space that is an finite set of mathematical values and that has these values explicitly stated.
A Maths_space that is an integer interval, bounded above, bounded below, or bounded both above and below.
A Maths_space that is an real interval, bounded above, bounded below, or bounded both above and below. Each bound can be either open or closed.

A Maths_space that has tuples as members. A Tuple_space can be defined as a Cartesian product of other mathematical spaces. Two approaches for defining the factors of the Cartesian product are provided:

li.example: The space of (integer, real) pairs is the Cartesian product of the spaces 'integer' and 'real'.

li.p: the space is specified with an exponent.
li.example: The space of real triples (i.e. R3) is defined by the space 'real' and the exponent 3.
